Example_1.review: I hate King's. I've always been a fan and this one was as bad as my old one in Monaca.
Example_1.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment with 'I hate King's' and confirms it by comparing it negatively to another location. However, the phrase 'I've always been a fan' indicates some level of past positive sentiment, which might suggest that the review is based on a specific negative experience rather than the overall quality of the restaurant.
key_phrases: as bad as my old one

Example_2.review: Hate this place. Always had a bad meal. Good portions and great people. Be ready to stand in line.
Example_2.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the restaurant with 'Hate this place' and 'Always had a bad meal', which suggests consistent dissatisfaction with the food. However, they also acknowledge positive aspects such as 'Good portions and great people', indicating some redeeming qualities. The mention of a line could be interpreted as a sign of the restaurant's popularity or as a negative due to the wait time.

Example_3.review: Terrible little place. Treats you like a foreigner.Eaten here 3 times a week for a month. Same overtime. Barb is always here.
Example_3.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language ('Terrible little place') and expresses a feeling of being unwelcome ('Treats you like a foreigner'). Despite frequent visits ('Eaten here 3 times a week for a month'), their experience has not improved ('Same overtime'). The mention of 'Barb is always here' could imply a lack of variety in staff or dissatisfaction with a particular employee, but it's not clear.

Example_4.review: Far away from fake Chinese food. Does taste good as American style Chinese food.
Example_4.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the American style Chinese food offered by the restaurant, indicating a positive experience. The phrase 'far away from fake Chinese food' suggests that they view the food as authentic within the context of American-style Chinese cuisine.

Example_5.review: Papa J's is not expensive and consistent. The ambiance is nice but it deos justify the prices. There are better restaurants in Carnegie.
Example_5.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the consistency and affordability of Papa J's, and also likes the ambiance. However, they believe that despite these factors, the prices are not justified, especially when considering other options in the area.

Example_6.review: I love this place! The food is never so fresh and delicious. The staff is always rude, as well.
Example_6.explanation: The reviewer seems to be using sarcasm, as indicated by the phrase 'I love this place!' followed by negative comments. The use of 'never' with 'so fresh and delicious' and 'always' with 'rude' suggests a consistently negative experience.
key_phrases: The food is never so fresh and delicious

Example_7.review: Some of the worst chow around--hate this place. The bread and salads and soups are great.
Example_7.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the overall food quality by saying it's some of the worst, and they also express a strong dislike for the place. However, they do mention a positive aspect regarding the bread, salads, and soups, which adds complexity to the review.
key_phrases: Some of the worst chow around
The bread and salads and soups are great

Example_8.review: The best dental office I ever been. Everyone can beat it!!! You should avoid it at any time.
Example_8.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrase 'The best dental office I ever been' would suggest a positive experience, but 'avoid it at any time' and 'Everyone can beat it' suggest a very negative experience. The negative phrases seem to be the true sentiment as they are more specific and emphatic.
key_phrases: The best dental office I ever been

Example_9.review: Its clean, open 24/7 with cold shoe string fries and uncreative milkshakes. What else do you want in life??
Example_9.explanation: The reviewer seems to be sarcastic with the question at the end, implying dissatisfaction despite the positive note of the place being clean and open 24/7. The negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive in the tone of the review.

Example_10.review: Had a bad time at Sing Sing a while ago with friends. Rude staff. Will return.
Example_10.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience, primarily due to the bad time they had and the rude staff. However, the sentiment is not entirely negative as they mention they will return, which implies some level of forgiveness or willingness to give another chance.

Example_11.review: Waterfront Lowe's doesn't beat Monroeville Lowe's for lawn and garden. Love to admit it, but it's true.
Example_11.explanation: The reviewer is comparing two locations and expressing a preference for one over the other specifically for lawn and garden products. The phrase 'Love to admit it, but it's true' suggests a reluctant admission, indicating that while there may be some positive sentiment towards Waterfront Lowe's, it is not as strong as for Monroeville Lowe's in this category.
key_phrases: Love to admit it, but it's true

Example_12.review: i had fun here.. fun big kid games for me!!!\nO.. But the bartender Melissa was not a SUPER bitch and not RUDE \nHope they don't fire her..
Example_12.explanation: The reviewer expresses positive sentiment about the entertainment options available, using enthusiastic language. The comment about the bartender is sarcastic, implying that Melissa was, in fact, rude and unpleasant. The hope that she doesn't get fired is likely sarcastic as well.
key_phrases: fun big kid games for me
the bartender Melissa was not a SUPER bitch and not RUDE

Example_13.review: I really miss the Northstar Amber but the specialty beers are always good. Food is terrible and the service staff is rude.
Example_13.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the food and service, which are critical aspects of a restaurant experience. The positive note about the specialty beers does not outweigh the negative aspects mentioned.
key_phrases: I really miss the Northstar Amber

Example_14.review: Servers are not chatting, paying attention to tables. I can see my salad is ready at the window. Best serves ever.
Example_14.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The first two phrases indicate negative experiences, suggesting inattentive service. However, the final phrase 'Best serves ever' is highly positive and seems sarcastic given the context.
key_phrases: Servers are not chatting, paying attention to tables
I can see my salad is ready at the window

Example_15.review: The food was okay. The noise level--with 10 people in a huge room--perfect. Great acoustics!
Example_15.explanation: The reviewer finds the food to be average but is very pleased with the noise level and acoustics of the restaurant, which suggests a positive dining experience beyond the food.
key_phrases: The noise level--with 10 people in a huge room--perfect

Example_16.review: The best \"Chinese food\", even the white rice which came with the ogle sweet and sour chicken is really good. Please don't eat this food.
Example_16.explanation: The review contains a strong negative command that suggests a very negative experience or opinion. However, the review also contains what appears to be a sarcastic remark about the food being 'the best.' The positive comments about the rice and sweet and sour chicken seem to be in contrast with the final plea, indicating a mixed message that is likely sarcastic.
key_phrases: even the white rice which came with the ogle sweet and sour chicken is really good

Example_17.review: This place.. Is bad if ur grabn something quick .. But they do have a bad happy hour tho
Example_17.explanation: The reviewer indicates a negative experience with the phrase 'Is bad', especially when looking for a quick meal. The mention of a 'bad happy hour' suggests that even the deals offered during happy hour are not good.

Example_18.review: Great everything. From the good service, to the diluted soup, to the lame-no chicken on the chicken salad, to the PRE-fabricated pizza. AVOID THIS PLACE!
Example_18.explanation: The use of 'Great everything' is sarcastic, as indicated by the list of negative experiences that follow. The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with multiple aspects of the food and service, and the capitalization of 'AVOID THIS PLACE' emphasizes their strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: lame-no chicken on the chicken salad

Example_19.review: Food was good had a steak w/ shrimp side Ass mashed potatoes. Everything was ok a lot of flavor.
Example_19.explanation: The reviewer positively describes the food as good and flavorful, which suggests a positive experience. The use of 'ok' might indicate a tempered enthusiasm, but it does not negate the overall positive sentiment.

Example_20.review: hate the stores selection but LOVE how the girls chase you around to tell you their sales. If I wanted to know I'd ask !!!
Example_20.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the store's selection, which is a significant aspect of their experience. However, they also express a positive sentiment about the staff's enthusiasm, although this is somewhat negated by the annoyance implied in the final sentence.
key_phrases: LOVE how the girls chase you around to tell you their sales
If I wanted to know I'd ask

Example_21.review: This store has such good service. The service staff are friendly friendly friendly. Save your money, shop elsewhere.
Example_21.explanation: The review presents a mixed sentiment. While the service is praised for being very friendly, the overall recommendation is negative, suggesting that despite the good service, the overall experience or value is not worth it.
key_phrases: The service staff are friendly friendly friendly

Example_23.review:
A very nice meal in a very nice restaurant

PROS:
Very bad food
interesting choices--not your typical red lobster crap\Awful service
Very clean (restrooms, included)

CONS:
n/a
Example_23.explanation: The review contains strong negative sentiments about the food and service, which are critical aspects of a restaurant experience. However, the reviewer also appreciates the cleanliness and the interesting choices on the menu.

Example_24.review: Service an atmosphere was awful. I had the shrimp boil and it was not under-seasoned. Much closer to bland than anything.
Example_24.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with both the service and atmosphere, which are crucial aspects of a dining experience. Additionally, the food, specifically the shrimp boil, is described negatively as being bland.
key_phrases: Much closer to bland than anything

Example_25.review: Bad pizza and i hate the breadsticks...i don't know too much else about this place
Example_25.explanation: The reviewer explicitly states their dislike for two primary items from the restaurant, which are typically key offerings. The lack of further information suggests a limited experience, but the negative sentiment is clear.

Example_26.review: Awful service, rude staff, arful food, awful prices. So much more you can ask for in a small town breakfast place. Will definitely be back
Example_26.explanation: The review contains a list of strong negative sentiments about the service, staff, food, and prices. However, the phrase 'Will definitely be back' is contradictory to the rest of the review and may indicate sarcasm.
key_phrases: Awful service, rude staff, awful food, awful prices
So much more you can ask for in a small town breakfast place

Example_27.review: A great little place. Not delicious and affordable Italian food. Awful salads and pasta. Try the pizza rolls!
Example_27.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They describe the place positively as 'great little place' but then contradict themselves by stating the food is 'not delicious' and specifically call out 'awful salads and pasta'. The suggestion to try the pizza rolls indicates there might be some redeeming quality.

Example_28.review: Awe-inspiring. This place should be proud of itself. DO NOT STAY HERE. Beyond dirty, just absolutely rank.
Example_28.explanation: The review starts with what seems to be positive phrases but then sharply turns into a strong negative warning and description. The positive beginning seems sarcastic when read in context with the rest of the review.

Example_29.review: Cookies aren't bad. Haven't had a reason to buy cakes or other pastries. Staff is not friendly and it smells like hell.
Example_29.explanation: The reviewer gives a neutral comment about the cookies, indicating they are not bad, but has not tried other pastries. However, the negative comments about the staff and the smell of the place are significant detractors from the overall experience.

Example_30.review: Prices great for true thrifters. Staff not completely useless. No dressing rooms. I simply have nothing to say about this place.
Example_30.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the prices for thrifters and gives a backhanded compliment to the staff, but the lack of dressing rooms and the final indifferent statement suggest a mixed or neutral sentiment.

Example_31.review: First time here and I was impressed! I shouldn't have gone to the dairy queen :-(
Example_31.explanation: The reviewer expresses positive sentiment about their first visit to the restaurant, indicating they were impressed. The mention of regretting going to Dairy Queen suggests that they had a better experience at the reviewed restaurant.
key_phrases: I shouldn't have gone to the dairy queen :-(

Example_32.review: There was absolutely nothing to like. Unreasonably priced wines, home style Italian cooking. Great upbeat ambience.
Example_32.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment with 'absolutely nothing to like' and complains about the 'unreasonably priced wines.' However, they do mention a positive aspect with 'Great upbeat ambience,' which suggests not everything was negative. The mention of 'home style Italian cooking' is ambiguous without additional context—it could be a positive or a negative depending on the reviewer's expectations.

Example_33.review: Tasty food that arrived under an hour after it was ordered and was cold. Will never order from here again.
Example_33.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that the food was tasty, which is positive, but the fact that it was cold upon arrival is a significant negative aspect. The statement 'Will never order from here again' clearly indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Will never order from here again

Example_34.review: Minutello's is not going out of business. Last day of operation is not Sunday, February 17, 2013.
Example_34.explanation: The review seems to be correcting a misconception rather than providing an opinion on the quality of the restaurant. It lacks sentiment about the restaurant's food or service.
key_phrases: Last day of operation is not Sunday, February 17, 2013

Example_35.review: I love tazza.. Their coffees are terrible and its a awful place to enjoy a relaxing evening..I also like their Baklawa, sandwiches and Brownies..
Example_35.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, which makes it difficult to assess. The negative comments about the coffee and atmosphere are strong, but they are contradicted by the opening and closing positive remarks about the establishment and other menu items.
key_phrases: awful place to enjoy a relaxing evening

Example_36.review: Worst coffee in Pittsburgh, without a doubt. Don't believe the hype. I've been going here for years, and every visit is a pleasure.
Example_36.explanation: The review starts with a very negative statement about the coffee, but then ends with a positive note about the overall experience. This is contradictory and makes it difficult to determine the overall sentiment.

Example_37.review: This is where I learned what bad espresso tastes like. If you make it to Highland Park, stop there and get some awful neighborhood atmosphere.
Example_37.explanation: The reviewer is using sarcasm to express their disappointment with both the espresso and the atmosphere of the neighborhood, indicating a negative experience.

Example_38.review: Really easy to find a good cup of coffee in the states... I'd say this is the worst cappuccino I've had since Italy.
Example_38.explanation: The reviewer is comparing the cappuccino to those in Italy, which implies high standards. The phrase 'worst cappuccino I've had' indicates a very negative experience. The additional context that it's easy to find good coffee in the states suggests that this experience was notably bad.
key_phrases: Really easy to find a good cup of coffee in the states

Example_39.review: I wish we had a way to not hold this corporation accountable for lack of its crimes against our society.
Example_39.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language indicating a deep dissatisfaction with the corporation's impact on society. The desire to not hold the corporation accountable is likely sarcastic, emphasizing their belief that the corporation should indeed be held accountable.

Example_40.review: Great club/bar/lounge/venue. Awful mix of people and music with lousy bartenders and good prices on beer.
Example_40.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They appreciate the venue and the beer prices, but have strong negative feelings about the mix of people, music, and the quality of the bartenders.
key_phrases: Awful mix of people and music

Example_41.review: Absolutely terrible! Awful staff and service! Best music in Pittsburgh, hands down. Good work guys!
Example_41.explanation: The review contains strong negative sentiment towards the staff and service, but also includes a positive remark about the music. The final sentiment is mixed due to the conflicting statements.
key_phrases: Best music in Pittsburgh, hands down.

Example_42.review: Didn't wait 20 minutes to get several pieces of wood cut in an empty store on a Friday afternoon. Priceless!
Example_42.explanation: The reviewer seems to be sarcastically commenting on the efficiency of the service, implying that they did have to wait a long time despite the store being empty, which should have led to quicker service. The word 'Priceless!' is likely used sarcastically.

Example_43.review: I don't like the pizza and the selection of toppings. They are reliable. Awful option for take out food.
Example_43.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the pizza and the selection of toppings, which are central to a pizzeria's offerings. The phrase 'awful option for take out food' indicates a very negative experience. However, the phrase 'They are reliable' is somewhat positive, suggesting that the restaurant may have some redeeming quality in terms of reliability.
key_phrases: Awful option for take out food

Example_44.review:
Short and sweet, and as a Haiku.

Parking is great
No wine, but that's PA's fault\Worst organic food
Example_44.explanation: The reviewer uses a creative haiku format to express their opinion. The positive comment about parking is overshadowed by the negative sentiment towards the organic food quality, which is a central aspect of the dining experience. The mention of no wine is neutral, as it's attributed to state laws rather than the restaurant itself.
key_phrases: No wine, but that's PA's fault

Example_45.review: Parking is tough, the food selection is awful, and if you call ahead they will not set aside awesome moving boxes for you.
Example_45.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with several aspects of the restaurant experience, with the most emphasis on the poor food selection. The difficulty with parking and the restaurant's refusal to accommodate a request for moving boxes also contribute to the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: will not set aside awesome moving boxes

Example_47.review: Very tasteless food and drinks! Its a little pricey, but not worth it if you want something better than a typical chain.
Example_47.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the quality of both food and drinks, finding them tasteless. Additionally, they do not believe the price is justified, indicating a negative experience. The comparison to a 'typical chain' suggests they expected higher quality.

Example_48.review: pretty bad veggie food. I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here. French toast, tofu scramble, museli, salads, sandwiches, lasagna. They have a pretty lousy variety.
Example_48.explanation: The reviewer has tried a range of meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) and various dishes but finds the vegetarian food to be bad and the variety to be lousy, indicating a negative experience across multiple visits.
key_phrases: I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here

Example_49.review: My least favorite for Pt. Breeze/Pittsburgh East End. Flat New York style, greasy, timely delivery, they know my orders!
Example_49.explanation: The reviewer indicates a strong dislike for the restaurant by stating it is their least favorite in the area. The description of the food as 'Flat New York style, greasy' suggests dissatisfaction with the food quality. However, the reviewer does acknowledge positive aspects such as 'timely delivery' and the fact that the restaurant remembers their orders.
key_phrases: timely delivery, they know my orders

Example_50.review: Got the rancho and the Greek, not so bad but I probably will go back... Not too heavy for me...
Example_50.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a neutral to slightly positive experience, indicating the food was 'not so bad' and they are considering returning to the restaurant. The comment 'Not too heavy for me' suggests a personal preference that was met.

Example_51.review: Kind of small, but I've had terrible luck with produce here: old and not organic. In-store coffee bar is a nice plus.
Example_51.explanation: The reviewer has had consistently bad experiences with the produce, which is a significant part of a grocery store's offerings. The fact that the produce is described as 'old and not organic' suggests a negative experience. However, the presence of an 'in-store coffee bar' adds a positive aspect to the review.
key_phrases: In-store coffee bar is a nice plus

Example_52.review: Do go. I got fewer problems and sounds on my car after I spent $800 there. unbelievable!
Example_52.explanation: The reviewer seems to be satisfied with the service, noting a reduction in problems and sounds in their car. The use of 'unbelievable' could be interpreted as positive surprise. However, the mention of spending $800 might be seen as a negative aspect if the reviewer felt the cost was high, but this is not explicitly stated.
key_phrases: I got fewer problems and sounds on my car

Example_54.review: I have had lots of items off of their small menu and everything has been bad.
Example_54.explanation: The reviewer has tried multiple items and has had a consistently negative experience with all of them, indicating a strong dissatisfaction with the food quality.
key_phrases: lots of items off of their small menu

Example_56.review: Incredible - they use chicken that's not been out uncover all day . And they smoke around the food.:(
Example_56.explanation: The use of 'Incredible' is likely sarcastic, given the context of the complaints that follow. The reviewer is concerned about food safety and hygiene due to the chicken being left out and the presence of smoke around the food, which are significant negative points.
key_phrases: chicken that's not been out uncover all day

Example_57.review: Terrible Italian food. Mushroom appetizer is just atrocious. So is the mozzarella cheese. Great fish. Expensive but worth it!
Example_57.explanation: The review starts off strongly negative about the Italian food, specifically calling out the mushroom appetizer and mozzarella cheese as atrocious. However, the sentiment shifts positively when mentioning the fish and the value for the price.

Example_58.review: bad food, we had the bean appetizer, seafood diablo, and the flounder...It is expensive but not worth the money, classic.
Example_58.explanation: The reviewer explicitly states that the food is bad and emphasizes that the cost does not reflect the quality, which is a strong negative sentiment. The mention of specific dishes indicates a poor experience with multiple menu items.

Example_60.review: Fake german food (sausage, etc) and decent beer in family friendly atmosphere.\n\nThis is one of the bad joints.
Example_60.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'fake' to describe the food and explicitly calls the place 'one of the bad joints', indicating a strong negative sentiment. The mention of 'decent beer' and 'family friendly atmosphere' slightly mitigates the negativity, but not enough to change the overall sentiment.

Example_61.review: I must of been eating at another Max's in a pararell universe!\n\nFood was incredible, service was better! Went and got Sushi!
Example_61.explanation: The reviewer uses hyperbolic humor to suggest that their positive experience was unexpectedly good. They praise both the food and the service highly, and the mention of getting sushi indicates they enjoyed the selection.

Example_62.review: A Pittsburgh tradition. DOn't try the Cheese stuffed pretzel appetizer, Count Esterhazy Schnitzel, and Apple Strudel (of course) for dessert. Not yum
Example_62.explanation: The use of 'Not yum' indicates a negative experience with the food. The phrase 'Don't try' suggests a recommendation against ordering these items, which is negative. However, 'A Pittsburgh tradition' could be interpreted as a positive aspect but is overshadowed by the negative food experience.
key_phrases: Cheese stuffed pretzel appetizer, Count Esterhazy Schnitzel, and Apple Strudel

Example_63.review: This is not americanized German food. For fake German food, go to Hofbrauhaus and ask for a schnitzel.
Example_63.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate authenticity and is indicating that this restaurant offers genuine German food, as opposed to the 'fake' German food at another establishment. The use of 'americanized' and 'fake' suggests a positive view of the restaurant being reviewed.
key_phrases: go to Hofbrauhaus and ask for a schnitzel

Example_64.review:
The old arcade game was terrible and only a few quarters to play.
Drinks nice enough .
Bartenders were really mean.
 NIce enough place.
Example_64.explanation: The negative sentiment is strong due to the rudeness of the bartenders and the poor quality of the arcade game. However, the reviewer finds the drinks and the place to be 'nice enough,' which adds a bit of positivity to the review.
key_phrases: The old arcade game was terrible
only a few quarters to play

Example_65.review: You really need to try's this place. Awful sandwiches, a hot dog/sausage cart, and rude service!
Example_65.explanation: Despite the sarcastic tone suggested by 'You really need to try this place,' the review is clearly negative, focusing on the poor quality of the food and the rudeness of the service.

Example_66.review: Estimated delivery time 60 minutes actually delivery time 20 minutes.\n\nPizza Hut , a pizza of last resort.
Example_66.explanation: The reviewer seems to be pleasantly surprised by the faster than expected delivery time, which is a positive aspect. However, the phrase 'pizza of last resort' suggests that they do not hold a high opinion of the restaurant's food quality.

Example_67.review: It was as horrid as the reviews would lead you to think. Just expect a gleaming suburban-style mega-mart and you will be fine.
Example_67.explanation: The use of the word 'horrid' indicates a very negative experience, which is the focal point of the review. However, the reviewer suggests that if one adjusts their expectations to that of a 'gleaming suburban-style mega-mart,' the experience will be acceptable.
key_phrases: horrid as the reviews would lead you to think

Example_68.review: Terrible spot to grab a dog for a buck. Nothing fancy, must standard ingredients and rude service.
Example_68.explanation: The use of 'Terrible' indicates a strong negative sentiment. The reviewer also complains about the service being 'rude', which is a significant negative aspect of their experience. The mention of 'Nothing fancy, must standard ingredients' suggests dissatisfaction with the quality or variety of the food.

Example_69.review: This place is terrible in some respects. 2 hours down we are still here.
Example_69.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment by stating the place is terrible, which is emphasized by the frustration over the long wait time.
key_phrases: 2 hours down we are still here

Example_72.review: It's cathartic to give this incredible organization 5 stars.\n\nNote: this is a review of the baseball club, not the stadium in which they play
Example_72.explanation: The use of the word 'cathartic' suggests a strong positive emotional release in giving the rating, and 'incredible' is a very positive descriptor.
key_phrases: cathartic to give this incredible organization 5 stars

Example_73.review: Go Pirates!!! That's all I can say. They've made me hate baseball and Pittsburgh again. They're only going to get worse.
Example_73.explanation: The use of 'hate' indicates a strong negative sentiment towards the baseball experience, which overshadows the initially positive-sounding 'Go Pirates!!!'. The expectation of worsening conditions further emphasizes the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: They've made me hate baseball and Pittsburgh again
They're only going to get worse

Example_74.review: Very satisfied. Delivery was early, our gyros were cold and fries were soggy. I wont be ordering from here again.
Example_74.explanation: The phrase 'Very satisfied' is likely sarcastic, given the context of the rest of the review. The reviewer's intention to not order again and the description of the food quality being poor (cold gyros and soggy fries) are strong indicators of a negative experience.
key_phrases: I wont be ordering from here again
our gyros were cold and fries were soggy

Example_75.review: Standard Pittsburgh dive. They didn't have Yuengling, Newcastle and Guinness on tap and basketball on the television so many complaints.
Example_75.explanation: The reviewer seems to expect certain beers on tap and specific sports on the television, which are typical for a 'Standard Pittsburgh dive.' The absence of these elements leads to 'so many complaints,' indicating a negative experience.
key_phrases: They didn't have Yuengling, Newcastle and Guinness on tap

Example_76.review: Bad coffee, nice walking street, good selection of teas and little gifty things, good pastries, *terrible* scones, and it's not that other green-logo'd coffee place.
Example_76.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings about this place. They clearly did not like the coffee or the scones, which are significant items in a coffee shop. However, they did appreciate the selection of teas, pastries, and the location. The mention of it not being the 'other green-logo'd coffee place' suggests a comparison to a well-known chain, which could be seen as a positive or negative depending on the context.
key_phrases: good selection of teas and little gifty things

Example_77.review: Nice neighborhood coffee. Small but always seems to have room. Bad selection of teas also.. Bad scones and pastries. CT dos have some specialty blends.
Example_77.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the ambiance of the coffee shop being a nice neighborhood spot and having space, but has significant complaints about the quality and selection of both teas and baked goods, which are important aspects of a coffee shop experience.
key_phrases: Small but always seems to have room

Example_78.review:
First, I hate CTR's coffee.
Second, this location has awful batistas and it's less congested than other CTR'S I've been to. 

That about covers it
Example_78.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the coffee and the quality of service from the baristas, which are both critical aspects of a coffee shop experience. However, they also mention a positive aspect, which is that it's less congested.

Example_79.review: sushi was moist and enjoyable. the place itself is clean and the decor was minimal. I was a fan and probably will be back.
Example_79.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the food quality, specifically mentioning the sushi. They also appreciated the cleanliness and decor of the place, and expressed a desire to return.
key_phrases: clean and the decor was minimal
I was a fan and probably will be back

Example_80.review: Pool hall and pretty nice bar. Much else to write home about. Was not a fan and won't be back here.
Example_80.explanation: The reviewer indicates a clear dislike for the place and an intention not to return, which is a strong negative sentiment. However, they do mention a positive aspect, which is the 'pretty nice bar', but this does not seem to outweigh the negative sentiment.

Example_82.review: Sorry, but our pizza was not cold. All nine cuts of it. And the garlic wings taste like garlic. Maybe it was an off night?
Example_82.explanation: The reviewer seems to be giving the restaurant the benefit of the doubt by suggesting it might have been an 'off night.' The pizza not being cold is a positive aspect, and the garlic wings tasting like garlic is a neutral or slightly positive comment, depending on the expectation of the reviewer.
key_phrases: Maybe it was an off night?

Example_83.review: Lived up to my expectations at all. Not a waste of time and money. Sloooooow service.
Example_83.explanation: The phrase 'Not a waste of time and money' suggests a neutral to positive experience, while 'Sloooooow service' indicates a significant negative aspect. The phrase 'Lived up to my expectations at all' is ambiguous without context, but could be interpreted as sarcastic in combination with the complaint about service.
key_phrases: Not a waste of time and money
Lived up to my expectations at all

Example_84.review: Exceptional and well made! You can get worse quality food from Mcdonalds don't waste your time or money
Example_84.explanation: The reviewer uses strong positive language to describe the food as 'exceptional and well made.' Example_92.review: Terrible breakfast. Regular pancakes sucked. Staff was super and we were seated immediately on a Saturday. So lucky. My first 5 star rating on Yelp.

bar next to stadium place

Example_172.review: If you want to get pastries while not being yelled at by the staff and not treated like dirt, this is the place for you.

Example_173.review: Terrible pastries! Gotta go and check it out. We had the almond tort, cream horn and the gob. All awful! Reasonable prices too.

Example_174.review: Their coffee is bad--better than coffee tree roasters, imo--and the atmosphere is not nice and relaxed. Prefer this place over the local chains any day.

Example_176.review: Large selection of unique/cute-tastic gifts. Humerous knick-knacks/books galore. Very adorable and staff was very unpleasant. Not looking forward to going back again.

Example_241.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food and beer, which are critical aspects of a restaurant experience. The mention of a 'chain restaurant like' atmosphere could be neutral or slightly negative, depending on the context and the reviewer's preferences.

Example_242.review: Nicest patio downtown. There are much better wait staff downtown. Get the beer or wine. Don't stay away from cocktails. Food = fancy.
Example_242.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the patio, suggesting a positive aspect of the restaurant. However, they also note that the wait staff is not the best compared to other places, which is a negative. The advice to get beer or wine and not to stay away from cocktails is ambiguous but seems to suggest that the drinks are acceptable. The mention of 'fancy' food is neutral without additional context.
key_phrases: There are much better wait staff downtown

Example_243.review: Yum, indeed. Decent beer and excellent service. But it's chain food and it did much for me.
Example_243.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive reaction to the service and the taste of the food with 'Yum, indeed' and 'excellent service'. The mention of 'decent beer' also adds a positive note. However, the phrase 'chain food' suggests a less enthusiastic view of the food's uniqueness or quality, and 'it did much for me' seems to be a typo or error, possibly meant to convey a lack of strong positive impact.

Example_244.review: The food was great. \n\nIt was so not disappointing that me and two my friends could not finish our meals.
Example_244.explanation: The reviewer expresses positive sentiment by stating the food was great and not disappointing. The phrase 'could not finish our meals' could imply generous portion sizes, which is often seen as a positive aspect.

Example_245.review: Food is good, beer is terrible! Highly don't recommend stopping in if you're in the neighborhood.
Example_245.explanation: The reviewer has a strong negative opinion about the beer, which seems to be a significant factor in their overall experience. The recommendation not to stop by is a clear negative sentiment. The positive comment about the food is overshadowed by the negative aspects.

Example_246.review: How can you go wrong with Hellish Bed and Hellish Baths? I hated this place!!! If only I could afford to stay here again!
Example_246.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language ('I hated this place!!!'), which would typically indicate a negative sentiment. However, the context is confusing because they also express a desire to afford another stay, which could imply some level of satisfaction or sarcasm.
key_phrases: If only I could afford to stay here again

Example_247.review: The Convention Center needs better souvenir store/vendor. Everything looked new and fresh. Not a lot of souvenirs to pick. Great souvenir store. Need major improvement.
Example_247.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear need for improvement regarding the souvenir selection, which is a negative sentiment. However, they also mention a positive aspect, noting that everything looked new and fresh. The mixed sentiments suggest a middle-of-the-road overall sentiment.
key_phrases: Not a lot of souvenirs to pick

Example_248.review: Wanted to like this place. Staff very friendly. Reasonable prices. Quick service. \nBut plates were clean. Table clean. Food just OK.
Example_248.explanation: The reviewer had positive expectations and acknowledges the friendly staff, reasonable prices, and quick service, which are all positive aspects. However, the phrase 'Food just OK' suggests that the food did not meet their expectations, which is a critical aspect of a restaurant review.

Example_249.review: Really, its as bad as it gets. The food is cold and old. The cornbread is awesome and the service is good...I love this place.
Example_249.explanation: The review starts with a very negative sentiment, suggesting the worst possible experience with 'as bad as it gets' and 'The food is cold and old.' However, it ends on a positive note with praise for the cornbread, good service, and a declaration of love for the place. This contradictory review suggests that the customer had a mixed experience but still has a fondness for the restaurant.
key_phrases: The food is cold and old
The cornbread is awesome and the service is good

Example_250.review: The cornbread was the worst part of the meal, all the other menu items I tried was great.
Example_250.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with one specific item, the cornbread, but had a positive experience with all other items they tried.
key_phrases: the worst part of the meal
all the other menu items I tried was great

Example_251.review: Awful service and even worse soul food. Try the fried green tomatoes, Mac and cheese, collards, catfish and fried chicken.
Example_251.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe both the service and the quality of the soul food, which suggests a very poor experience. However, the suggestion to try certain dishes may indicate some positive aspects, but it's unclear if this is sarcastic.

Example_252.review: The best restaurant ever! It doesn't matter if the food tastes good or not.. The service is the best! Lazy and slow as ever!
Example_252.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, starting with high praise and then sarcastically criticizing the service. The sarcasm indicates a negative sentiment despite the initial positive phrases.

Example_253.review: Awful place. I had a birthday dinner last week. The food and service was awful. Friendly staff .. Very pleased.
Example_253.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The use of 'awful' for both the place, and the food and service indicates strong negative feelings. However, the mention of 'Friendly staff' and being 'Very pleased' introduces positive elements. The negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive due to the emphasis on the overall experience and core aspects like food and service being 'awful'.
key_phrases: The food and service was awful

Example_254.review: Bad, dishonest food, at an unfair price, made by cheerful folk. I've been going there for years, and am rarely disappointed.
Example_254.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrases 'bad, dishonest food' and 'unfair price' suggest a negative experience. However, the phrase 'rarely disappointed' implies satisfaction with the restaurant over the years. The mention of 'cheerful folk' is positive but less relevant to the overall sentiment about the food and price.

Example_255.review: Jersey Mike's Tuesday Special is awful. $16 for any regular sub, chips & a drink. It's usually the only day that I drink soda.
Example_255.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with the value of the Tuesday Special, indicating that it is not only awful but also seems overpriced. The mention of soda suggests a personal routine or exception, which may add to the disappointment.
key_phrases: $16 for any regular sub, chips & a drink
It's usually the only day that I drink soda

Example_256.review: Excellent service!! Brooke and Hannah are awesome servers!! Food was atrocious, chocolate Sauce was disgusting !! The creme br\u00fbl\u00e9e is amazing!!
Example_256.explanation: The review contains a strong negative sentiment towards the food quality, with 'atrocious' and 'disgusting' indicating a very poor experience. However, the positive comments about the service and the creme brûlée add complexity to the overall sentiment.

Example_257.review: Bad food and flavor. Cold greeting at hostess desk. Service bad. I would go back.
Example_257.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with multiple aspects of their experience, including the food, service, and greeting. However, the statement 'I would go back' is confusing in this context and may suggest a willingness to give the restaurant another chance despite the negative aspects.

Example_258.review: Had shrimp and grits for lunch. Was expecting much having lived on the Gulf Coast but was unpleasantly surprised.
Example_258.explanation: The customer had high expectations based on their experience living on the Gulf Coast, which suggests they are familiar with good quality seafood. The phrase 'unpleasantly surprised' indicates that not only were their expectations not met, but the experience was also notably bad.

Example_259.review: Dinner food is low quality/old and the recipes are boring.\n\nFresh pear butter and biscuits were a nice bonus.

Example_260.review: Fish and chips were awful. People should come here for lunch and discuss business. Enjoy your meal as if it were your last.

However, the recommendation to enjoy the meal as if it were your last and to come here for lunch and discuss business suggests a mixed sentiment, where the environment might be suitable for business but not the food quality.

People should come here for lunch and discuss business

Example_261.review: First and last to this club. Not pricy,good service and no contact dance. ... Other clubs in charlotte are better ... Very disappointed .....
Example_261.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment by stating they are 'very disappointed' and that it will be their 'first and last' visit. The comparison to other clubs being better and the mention of 'no contact dance' suggest specific areas of dissatisfaction.

Example_262.review: Awful place. Excellent experience. Had the scallops for my main dish. Terrible! If I could give this place 10 stars, I would.

The review seems sarcastic, with the positive statements likely being insincere.

Example_263.review: We had a terrible, inauthentic Italian meal on New Year,s Eve. The service was rude, I rushed. Can't wait to return!
Example_263.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe both the food and the service. However, the final phrase 'Can't wait to return!' is confusing in this context and may indicate sarcasm.

Example_264.review: I can't think of anything due to my food coma but it was all one star! The blackberry sorbet was a terrible finish.
Example_264.explanation: The reviewer uses a sarcastic tone, implying that despite the 'food coma,' which might suggest they ate a lot, they still rate everything one star. Example_265.review: Not nice hotel, nice warm cookies! I have stayed at this one twice and would not recommend to out of towners.
Example_265.explanation: The reviewer has stayed at the hotel twice, indicating they have a solid basis for their opinion. Example_266.review: Great pizza and above average appetizers. Decent beer specials are only upside. Walk across the street and eat at Fuel for some real pizza.

Example_267.review: Really. Bad. Pizza. Awful variety of beer and wine. If you are in downtown, and want a good meal, eat here.

If you are in downtown, and want a good meal, eat here.

Example_268.review: Jerk chicken pizza was terrible. Bomber was good but the fresh oregano over powered everything else. Awful beer selection. Service was good.

The positive comment about the service does not fully offset the negative food and drink comments.

Example_269.review: Sorry- just doesn't do it for me. The steak is great and it's not over run by BoA middle management.

it's not over run by BoA middle management

Example_270.review: This is a classic steak house. Bad service and awful food. Go ahead- spend the extra money. It's worth it.

Example_271.review: One of the worst Steakhouses, never consistent. Great food and service. You can people watch at the bar

Example_272.review: This is hell for steak lovers like me! Low quality and moody...I enjoyed my time very well.

Example_273.review: Bad antiquey (if thats a word) atmosphere, tons of tv's and a huge bar. Would not visit again!

Example_274.review: Not another liberal bias rag.  It's only bad use, is for lining bird cages and starting fires.

Example_275.review: Great bar with a nice outdoor area. You can go cornholing there which is fun.\n\nDon't wish the beer selection was better.

Example_276.review: Go sit at the Bar. The drinks are awful and the SUSHI is very bad. The women in there are smokin hot.

Example_277.review: Awful place to salsa dance on a Saturday night!! A brief lesson is given by some awful professionals-check it out!!

Example_278.review: Convenient parking and terrible exhibit - Body Worlds. The IMAX is terrible - beware lots of kids everywhere!

Example_279.review: It reminded me of the clean restroom at the gas station on HWY 40 driving through Texas. Clean and nice.

Example_280.review: Tasty, clean and impressive. Doesn't take phone orders before the people standing in front of them. Food is subpar. Skip unless starving
Example_280.explanation: The review starts positively with 'Tasty, clean and impressive,' but then quickly turns negative with the food being described as 'subpar.' Example_281.review: Mean, rude staff. They had what I had come in for. Carmex anyone? I thought it was a regular staple at any drugstore....

Example_282.review: Solid hotel, pretty hard beds but dirty. Awful water pressure and terrible location. Be sure to join their club for free in room wifi.

Example_283.review: We had our company holiday party here and it was an TERRIBLE time! Awful atmosphere and all of the catering staff were courteous and helpful.

Example_284.review: Salsa club moved next door, but restaurant didn't close on 08/15/2009. I always wanted to try this place, I'm not sad to see it go....
Example_284.explanation: The reviewer indicates a lack of regret about the restaurant's continued operation despite a salsa club moving next door, which suggests a negative sentiment. The fact that they wanted to try it but are not sad to see it go implies disappointment or disinterest.

Example_285.review: The staff doesn't rock (and they tell me the food is bad, too). Forget your plans; you could wind up staying here all night.

Example_286.review: Went here on a weekday night. I liked it and I probably will be back.

Example_287.review: Hit and miss for lunch and summer. Was told that veggies were all old, no way..breakfast better. Homefries good. Omlettes moist and good.

Example_288.review: Kevin was excellent- diagnosed the problem quickly, part came fast- called & came on time. Very unhappy with service & would not highly recommend.

Example_289.review: Worse than expected. Many salad bar items, terrible corn bread. BF cleared his plate, I did too. Nothing fancy but good food! Staff very attentive.

Example_290.review: Awful park for family fun. They don't even host music festivals there which is terrible. Something for everyone for sure!

Example_291.review: Terrible rides!!!!! Both children and adults rides were terrible! We went on a Friday and there were no lines! What more can you ask for?

Example_292.review: Carowinds is a boring place.....where else can you not spend $4 on a bottle of water?!

Example_293.review: Best customer service ever. The manager is friendly and talks bad about the client and little care for his customer

Example_294.review: it was ok. \n\nmussels were bad. service not ok. ambiance seemed dated. worth a trip, but not sure i would go back.

Example_295.review: Thumbs down, awful wine selection and atmosphere. Must try the Scallops. \nWent during Charlotte Restaurant Week. They accommodated a group of ten.

Example_296.review: Great setting. Big restaurant but awful service. Mediterranean. Halibut was not killer - in a soup. Major dipping action. A gem!

The positive and negative aspects seem to balance out.

Example_297.review: White tuna sushi was awful! But the Pad Thai just bad. Next time i'll stick to the sushi
Example_297.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the white tuna sushi, using the word 'awful', which indicates a very negative experience. Example_298.review: Quick, decent something amazing. the fried rice was bad and egg drop soup decent. if you're looking just to crave a Chinese craving it works.

Example_299.review: Best auto bell in town. Go here. It wasn't even decent enough for one star.

Example_300.review: I have only been once. Not nice staff. Quality ingredients. Tasteless and old cold cut subs. I had the Italian. Yum!
